title: (x) compressed sans used in Feltron 2006 Annual Report - Opti Giant {Lex}
content:
If anyone knows what this typeface is :

[http://feltron.com/index.php?/content/2006\_annual\_report](http://web.archive.org/web/20080204005550/http:/feltron.com/index.php?/content/2006_annual_report "http://feltron.com/index.php?/content/2006\_annual\_report")

I will be very thankful.

Cheers

Ash

 [‹ Urgently seeking: Sirius](http://web.archive.org/web/20080204005550/http:/typophile.com/node/41481 "Go to previous forum topic") [Auberges de Jeunesse Bauhaus-like display sans ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080204005550/http:/typophile.com/node/41579 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Ashleyco

comments.content:
This has come up many times before. I believe the answer was a custom face designed by Nicholas Felton, with Knockout as a good alternative. I’ll try to find a link.

- Lex

<cite>EDIT: Tom Felton? I’ve got Harry Potter on the brain.</cite>

[http://www.typophile.com/node/30592](http://web.archive.org/web/20080204005550/http:/www.typophile.com/node/30592 "http://www.typophile.com/node/30592")

It’s not custom - it’s Opti Giant, which is no longer available.

- Lex
